metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0240 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Netlogon server implementation in smbd in Samba 3.5.x and 3.6.x before3.6.25, 4.0.x before 4.0.25, 4.1.x before 4.1.17, and 4.2.x before 4.2.0rc5performs a free operation on an uninitialized stack pointer, which allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted Netlogon packetsthat use the ServerPasswordSet RPC API, as demonstrated by packets reachingthe _netr_ServerPasswordSet function inrpc_server/netlogon/srv_netlog_nt.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
python-samba - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
registry-tools - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-common - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-libs - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
smbclient - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
winbind - 2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: samba package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.13+dfsg-4ubuntu2').
